segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of a message and to transmit the identifying number.
DTM, A segment to indicate the date and time on which the particular container has been ascertained as being in stock (stock check date/time).
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information, such as: - change information

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify a reference relating to the whole message, and its date and/or time.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message, such as: - reference to previous message
DTM, A segment to indicate date and/or time related to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify a party and/or addresses and related contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name and address, and function, such as: - message recipient - message sender - ordering customer - ordering customer agent

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department of a message sender and/or message recipient, such as: - information contact
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to specify containers in stock of the sending party, including relevant details by individual container number or grouped and total by type and size.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify the prefix and number of the container, its status and a full/empty indication.
RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the particular container, such as: - container announcement reference number - acceptance order reference

DTM, A segment to indicate the date and time on which the particular container has been ascertained as being in stock (stock check date/time), and to indicate when the container has been delivered at the stock keeper (actual equipment positioning date/time).
LOC, A segment to indicate a port/place according to the corresponding container, such as: - stack position
COD, A segment to specify the details of the components of transport equipment.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions related to the container equipment.
EQN, To specify the number of units of a particular type and size of equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments to specify damage details related to the equipment.

segment.documentation: DAM, A segment to specify equipment damages, such as the point of the damage on the equipment, and the type of damage.
COD, A segment to specify component details of the damaged equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to specify transport details related to the container.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information about sea transport related to the container (main carriage transport), such as voyage number/indication sea transport, vessel and carrier/liner service.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments to specify locations related to the main carriage of the container equipment.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to specify a location related to the main carriage of the container such as port of discharge.
DTM, A segment to specify date(s) and time(s) related to a location.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A segment group to identify dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to specify dangerous goods.
FTX, A segment to specify supplementary details regarding the dangerous goods such as the technical name of the dangerous goods etc.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements of the dangerous goods, such as: - net net weight.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A segment group to specify contact information including communication details regarding the dangerous goods.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department to be contacted regarding the dangerous goods.
COM, A segment to specify communication details of the contact specified in the CTA segment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A segment group to identify transport related temperature settings.

segment.documentation: TMP, A segment to specify the type of transport related temperature such as storage, transport or operating temperature and also to optionally specify a single value temperature setting.
RNG, A segment to optionally specify the transport related temperature such as a range of values.
CNT, A segment to specify the number of containers in the message, explicitly given by the sender.
